MainCategory.Description: Technical Proficiency: Assesses the candidate's depth and breadth of knowledge in required technologies, including programming languages, databases, and web technologies. It also evaluates their ability to apply this knowledge to develop, maintain, and troubleshoot software systems.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate through resume review, technical interviews (coding exercises, system design discussions), and review of past projects (portfolio or GitHub). Verify certifications where applicable.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Demonstrates mastery of core technologies (C#, .NET, SQL) and related technologies. Shows ability to independently solve complex technical problems and design robust systems.
Strong understanding of core technologies with some experience in related areas. Can contribute effectively to development tasks and troubleshoot common issues.
Basic understanding of core technologies but requires guidance on more complex tasks. May need assistance with troubleshooting and debugging.
Limited understanding of required technologies. Requires significant training and supervision.
Lacks essential technical skills for the role.

MainCategory.Description: Problem-Solving Skills: This evaluates the candidate's ability to analyze complex problems, develop effective solutions, and implement them efficiently. It includes troubleshooting skills, debugging capabilities, and the ability to think critically under pressure.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess through technical interview questions involving problem-solving scenarios. Review past projects for evidence of problem-solving abilities. Observe performance during coding exercises.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills. Can quickly identify root causes of complex issues and develop innovative solutions.
Strong problem-solving skills. Can effectively troubleshoot and debug common issues and develop viable solutions.
Adequate problem-solving skills. Can identify and resolve straightforward issues with some guidance.
Developing problem-solving skills. Requires assistance with identifying and resolving complex issues.
Lacks fundamental problem-solving skills necessary for the role.

MainCategory.Description: Communication & Collaboration: Assesses the candidate's ability to effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences. It also evaluates their ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Observe communication skills during the interview process. Assess teamwork abilities through behavioral interview questions and reference checks. Evaluate the candidate's ability to explain technical concepts clearly.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Can effectively communicate complex technical information and works seamlessly in a team environment.
Strong communication and collaboration skills. Can clearly convey technical information and collaborates effectively with team members.
Adequate communication and collaboration skills. Can communicate technical information and work in a team setting, but may need improvement in certain areas.
Developing communication and collaboration skills. Requires improvement in expressing technical ideas and working effectively with others.
Poor communication and collaboration skills. Struggles to communicate technical information and work effectively in a team.

MainCategory.Description: Experience & Education: Evaluates the candidate's relevant work experience and educational background, focusing on alignment with the job requirements. It includes the depth and breadth of experience in software development, relevant technologies, and industry knowledge.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review resume and academic transcripts. Verify work experience through reference checks. Assess the relevance of past projects and roles to the current job requirements.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Extensive relevant experience and a strong educational background. Exceeds the required experience level and has a proven track record of success.
Solid relevant experience and a suitable educational background. Meets the required experience level and has a good understanding of the field.
Sufficient experience and education to meet the basic job requirements. May need some additional training or experience in certain areas.
Limited relevant experience or educational background. Requires significant training and experience to meet the job requirements.
Lacks the necessary experience and education for the role.

MainCategory.Description: Adaptability & Learning Agility: Assesses the candidate's ability to adapt to changing priorities, learn new technologies quickly, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. It includes their willingness to embrace new challenges and continuously improve their skills.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess through behavioral interview questions, focusing on past experiences with change and learning. Evaluate the candidate's willingness to learn new technologies. Observe their ability to think on their feet during technical discussions.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Highly adaptable and possesses exceptional learning agility. Quickly grasps new concepts and readily embraces new challenges.
Demonstrates good adaptability and learning agility. Can adapt to changing priorities and learn new technologies effectively.
Adequate adaptability and learning agility. Can adapt to some changes and learn new technologies with some guidance.
Limited adaptability and learning agility. Struggles to adapt to changing priorities and learn new technologies effectively.
Lacks the necessary adaptability and learning agility for the role.

SubCategory.Description: Code Quality: Evaluates the quality, readability, and maintainability of the candidate's code. This encompasses adherence to coding standards, use of best practices, and the ability to write clean and efficient code.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review code samples submitted by the candidate (portfolio, GitHub). Conduct code reviews during technical interviews.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Code is exceptionally clean, well-documented, and follows best practices.
Code is generally clean and readable with minor areas for improvement.
Code is functional but requires significant refactoring and lacks documentation.

SubCategory.Description: Testing and Debugging: Assesses the candidate's proficiency in writing unit tests, integration tests, and debugging software applications. This includes the ability to identify and resolve bugs efficiently.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate the candidate's approach to testing and debugging during technical interviews. Review test cases written by the candidate.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Demonstrates a strong understanding of testing methodologies and debugging techniques. Writes comprehensive unit and integration tests.
Familiar with testing and debugging but may require guidance on more complex issues.
Limited experience with testing and debugging. Struggles to identify and resolve bugs effectively.

SubCategory.Description: Database Knowledge: Evaluates the candidate's understanding of database concepts, SQL, and experience with database technologies relevant to the role (e.g., Microsoft SQL Server, T-SQL).
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess through technical interview questions focused on database design, query optimization, and data modeling.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Expert knowledge of database concepts and SQL. Can design and optimize complex database schemas.
Solid understanding of database concepts and SQL. Can write efficient queries and perform basic database administration tasks.
Limited understanding of database concepts. Requires assistance with writing complex queries and database administration tasks.

SubCategory.Description: System Configuration & Maintenance: Assesses the candidate's ability to maintain and modify system configurations, troubleshoot issues, and ensure system stability. This is crucial for production, staged, and test environments.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's experience with system administration and configuration management through behavioral and technical questions. Verify experience with relevant tools and technologies.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Expert in system configuration and maintenance. Proactively identifies and resolves issues before they impact system stability.
Proficient in system configuration and maintenance. Can troubleshoot and resolve common system issues effectively.
Limited experience with system configuration and maintenance. Requires significant guidance and supervision.

SubCategory.Description: API & Integration Experience: Evaluates the candidate's experience in developing and integrating with APIs (Application Programming Interfaces), including understanding of RESTful principles and data exchange formats like XML and JSON.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess through technical interview questions focusing on API design, implementation, and security. Review past projects involving API integration.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Expert in API design and integration. Can develop and integrate with complex APIs securely and efficiently.
Strong understanding of API concepts and integration techniques. Can develop and integrate with basic APIs.
Limited experience with API development and integration. Requires significant guidance and training.
